segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink in a steady stream.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's almost mesmerizing, like a waterfall in my kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The adult woman seems entirely unaware of the chaos developing at her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She’s so focused on that plate, drying it as if it were the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she even feels her foot is soaked in that expanding puddle.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children, meanwhile, are up to something sneaky.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is teetering on that rickety stool, a cookie jar in his grasp.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can't help but feel a pang of guilt for not warning her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl stands there, begging with her hand raised, eyeing the cookies with delight.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It's a picture of innocence, but also of danger.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Everything outside looks so serene, contrasting sharply with this kitchen chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I’m a spectator in a play, watching a scene unfold that could end badly.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Will the boy grab the cookie and tumble off the stool?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I want to shout out a warning, but I stay silent, frozen in my spot.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This scene is all too familiar, a blend of routine and impending disaster.
segments.speaker: PAR
